text: `adjustPan` and `adjustResize` can't be set together.
Hence your issue - set `adjustPan` only.

text: i guess i still have some rupees from my last trip :wink:
sorry

Okay, so you have a `Manager` class that encapsulates a static instance of a `ThreadPoolExecutor` that has a `BlockingQueue`. I also have a `Task` object and a `TaskRunnable`. The `TaskRunnable` is then created by the `Manager` when a new task is desired, the `TaskRunnable` takes a `Task` to operate on, and then the `ThreadPoolExecutor` adds the `TaskRunnable` to the `BlockingQueue`, which then passes tasks to the thread pool. Yeah?
it doesn’t *have* to have a manager class
but yes
right, I know the manager isn't necessary
also be aware you can use things like futures to get better control but that isn’t always necessary

basically I'm trying to pass a set of comments with markdown in them to a threadpoolexecutor so that I can parse the comments quickly. I get all the comments at once from a network call, so do I just dump the whole list into the manager and then iterate over that list and spawn a new `Task` for each one?
I guess that's maybe the part I'm not super clear about. How exactly to pass the tasks to the threadpoolexecutor without overloading the queue
your queue should be unbounded so that should not be a concern
the real choice is do you need to process comments individually or in chunks?
thread switching as a cost so its probably more efficient to work on comments in chunks
like 5 or 10 comments at a time

you definitely could do it per comment though. I would use some sort of notification system for the finished processing to report back the status of success or possible a failure if that is something that can happen
the notification system would be responsible for either relying the processed comments have been stored or maybe just pass them back if you have no interest in keeping them on disk
i could totally chunk them up
and make a task with 5-10 comments in it
that would not be a problem
:thumbsup:
took me a second to understand what you meant, but that makes total sense
if you make your workers take lists them it doesn’t matter what the chunk size is, maybe later you decide to make it 100 or 1 for example
I'm kind of overoptimizing with a threadpool right now
we're talking 400 comments tops, and that takes a whole second to process
but I figure its pretty damn scalable
if i do it this way now
are you using RX?
no
i should be
if you did this in RX it would be super simple =P
I just haven't taken the time to learn Rx yet
procrastinating on that.
gotcha
it's starting to fall into place
thanks for helping
something like that in RX would break up the input into sub lists and create threads to run it all
this isn’t a perfect solution for a lot of reasons but it is similar to what I said before

wow that looks awesome. Rx is the next thing on my list to learn
yeah, the subscribeOn in this case would probably want to use an executer for the scheduler so you dont end up with 30 threads or more doing work that lasts a few hundred milliseconds
